definitions.text: one of a set of small pieces of stiff paper marked in various ways and used for playing games or for telling fortunes
examples: he collected cards and traded them with the other boys

definitions.text: a card certifying the identity of the bearer
examples: he had to show his card to get in

definitions.text: a rectangular piece of stiff paper used to send messages (may have printed greetings or pictures)
examples: they sent us a card from Miami

definitions.text: a witty amusing person who makes jokes
a sign posted in a public place as an advertisement
examples: a poster advertised the coming attractions

definitions.text: a printed or written greeting that is left to indicate that you have visited
(golf) a record of scores (as in golf)
examples: you have to turn in your card to get a handicap

definitions.text: a list of dishes available at a restaurant
(baseball) a list of batters in the order in which they will bat
examples: the managers presented their cards to the umpire at home plate

definitions.text: a printed circuit that can be inserted into expansion slots in a computer to increase the computer's capabilities
ask someone for identification to determine whether he or she is old enough to consume liquor
examples: I was carded when I tried to buy a beer!
